meanings.definition: Spread or smear (a substance) thinly over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys schmearing cream cheese on her bagel every morning.
meanings.sent2: The baker was schmearing icing on the freshly baked cake.
meanings.sent3: While schmearing peanut butter on the bread, she accidentally got some on her nose.
meanings.sent4: The artist skillfully schmeared paint across the canvas, creating a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands were schmearing colorful paint all over the paper, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To spread or apply (a substance) in a thin layer.
meanings.sent1: He carefully schmears butter on the warm toast.
meanings.sent2: The chef was schmearing sauce on the pizza dough.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be schmearing its fur with dirt after playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The rain was schmearing the colors of the painting on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: She was schmearing sunscreen on her skin to protect it from the sun.

meanings.definition: To cover or coat with a thin layer of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter schmears a layer of varnish on the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: She was schmearing honey on the warm biscuits.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was schmearing mud on the walls of the house.
meanings.sent4: The fog was schmearing the view of the mountains in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The chef was schmearing chocolate sauce on the dessert plate for decoration.
